types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an id. This id uniquely identifies exactly one object.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally unique identifier

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: _ScapholdRole
types.description: An access management role.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The role name. These are case sensitive.

types.name: _ScapholdRoleAccessLevel
types.description: Describes the access level of a role. 'public' roles permit anyone to join and 'private' roles are managed by admin users.

enumValues.name: public
enumValues.description: The role is set to auto-enroll users

enumValues.name: private
enumValues.description: The role is managed by a set of admin users. Only admin users can change enrollment. The user creating the role is automatically configured as an admin.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A user's globally unique ID.

fields.name: username
fields.description: A required field that is guaranteed to be unique. Because the username is used to log a user in, people often use a user's email as their username but this is not required.

fields.name: roles
fields.description: A list of roles in which this user is enrolled

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: An automatically managed timestamp that is set when an object is first created.

fields.name: modifiedAt
fields.description: An automatically managed timestamp that is set whenever an object is mutated.

fields.name: lastLogin
fields.description: An automatically managed timestamp that is set every time a user logs in.

args.name: after
args.description: An opaque cursor required for forward pagination. Result sets begin with the first object following this cursor in the connection set.

args.name: first
args.description: The number of edges to return that follow the 'after' cursor in the connection set. Required for forward pagination.

args.name: before
args.description: An opaque cursor required for backwards pagination. Result sets begin with the first object following this cursor in the connection set.

args.name: last
args.description: The number of edges to return that precede the 'before' cursor in the connection set. Required for backwards pagination.

args.name: orderBy
args.description: Specifies a field to sort the connection by. To sort in descending order prepend the field name with a '-'. By default connections are sorted by createdAt desc.

types.name: _ScapholdEnrollment
types.description: Enroll a user in a role.

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role name. These are case sensitive.

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The id of the user to enroll.

fields.name: isAdmin
fields.description: Determines if the user is an admin for the role.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The `DateTime` type represents a single point in time and is stored with millisecond precision plus a time zone specified by ISO 8601. All types come preloaded with createdAt and modifiedAt timestamps that are automatically managed for you.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: Root mutation field

fields.name: migrateSchema
fields.description: Migrate your schema.

fields.name: createRole
fields.description: Creates a new role. You must be authenticated to create a role and creating a 'private' role will automatically enroll the logged in user as an admin.

fields.name: deleteRole
fields.description: Deletes a role. Only admin users may delete a role.

fields.name: enrollUser
fields.description: Enrolls a user into a role. If the role is 'private' this can only be done by the role's admin users.

fields.name: disenrollUser
fields.description: Disenrolls a user from a role. If the role is 'private' this can only be done by the role's admin users or yourself.

inputFields.name: commit
inputFields.description: If true, the migration will immeditely be applied. If false, the migration will be validated and the migration steps will be returned.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the dataset

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Description of the dataset

types.name: _MigrateScapholdTypeInput
types.description: Input object type for creating data types

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the data type

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The datatype's kind

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the data type

inputFields.name: fields
inputFields.description: Scaphold type fields

inputFields.name: permissions
inputFields.description: Fine tune user authorizations by adding permissions to a type.

inputFields.name: isSearchable
inputFields.description: Set this flag to index this type to be searchable.

types.name: _ScapholdTypeKind
types.description: Available data types for user schema types.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Object data kind. Currently this is the only kind supported

types.name: _MigrateScapholdFieldInput
types.description: Input type for creating data types

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Name of the field

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Description for the field

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: One of [String, Int, Float, Boolean, List, Connection, or a user defined object type]

inputFields.name: ofType
inputFields.description: The name of ofType for List and Connection types.

inputFields.name: nonNull
inputFields.description: Determines if this field is nullable or not.

inputFields.name: unique
inputFields.description: Determines if this field is enforced to be unique.

inputFields.name: reverseName
inputFields.description: Name of the connection field in the related type.

inputFields.name: defaultValue
inputFields.description: A default value for the field. This is an AnyObject because it can take many forms depending on this field's type. This field is checked at migration time to make sure it is of the correct type.

types.name: _MigrateScapholdPermissionInput
types.description: Enables advanced access control for your application

inputFields.name: create
inputFields.description: Enables access to create operations on this type.

inputFields.name: read
inputFields.description: Enables access to read operations on this type.

inputFields.name: update
inputFields.description: Enables access to update operations on this type.

inputFields.name: delete
inputFields.description: Enables access to delete operations on this type.

inputFields.name: replace
inputFields.description: Enables access to replace operations on this type.

inputFields.name: scope
inputFields.description: Define the scope of this permission.

inputFields.name: roles
inputFields.description: A list of roles that validate the permission against.

inputFields.name: userFields
inputFields.description: A list of strings for the related fields on the parent type that have are under the scope of this permission.

types.name: _ScapholdPermissionScope
types.description: Specifies the scope of a permission.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQLs execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
